result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gabriel S Becker

defendant.name: Becker, Gabriel S

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Gabriel S Becker in court, in custody, with attorney Adam J. Schleis.   David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The charges are dismissed and read into 16CF10.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 13, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Gabriel S Becker in court, in custody, with attorney Adam J. Schleis.   Ted Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Schleis requests an adjournment and that the Defendant be granted Huber Bailee Status.  The State objects to the request for Huber Bailee Status.  The Court adjourns the hearing and denies the request for huber bailee status and bail remains as set.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 13, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 5, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to take prescriptions as prescribed.   Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.

Defendant Gabriel S Becker in court with attorney Adam J. Schleis.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court addresses the defendant's non compliance with WCS.  Attorney Schleis requests bail remain as set.  Attorney Behm requests the Court increase cash bail. The Court sets cash bail in the amount of $500.00.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 5, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Hearing on March 22, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Adam J. Schleis in court.   Defendant Gabriel S Becker did not appear.   Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   The Court addresses the negative WCS report.  The Court issues but stays a capias until next hearing.  Hearing scheduled for March 22, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Notice of Hearing returned, for hearing scheduled on: 2/15/16 at 9:00 a.m.
Hearing at 03-18-2016 09:30 am
From defendant received 1/25/16 requesting bail reduction and quick Court proceedings.
From defendant received 1/22/16 requesting signature bond.
From defendant received 1/20/16 requesting reconsideration of bail.
From defendant received 1/19/16 requesting to make plea and sentencing and change of Judge.
From defendant received 1/19/16 requesting quick and speedy Court proceedings.
From defendant received 1/19/16 requesting cases be quick and sentencing be 2/15/16 or sooner.
From defendant received 1/19/16 requesting plea and sentencing as soon as possible.
From defendant received 1/19/16 requesting a change in Judge.
Hearing at 02-15-2016 09:00 am

Defendant Gabriel S Becker in court, in custody, with attorney Adam J. Schleis.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Attorney Schleis has not received discovery on the felony file yet but does have them on the CM files and advises the Court the Defendant would be a good candidate for Drug Treatment Court.  Attorney Schleis requests the Court modify bail to $750.00 cash on 16CF10.  The Court denies the motion for bail reduction/modification.   Hearing scheduled for February 15, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Hearing at 01-15-2016 10:00 am

Defendant Gabriel S Becker in court.  Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Defendant advises the Court he has not retained counsel.  The Court orders the Defendant to apply at the public defender's office and return back to court.  The case is recalled with the same appearances and the Defendant does qualify for appointment of counsel by the public defender's office and an attorney will be appointed.
Hearing at 12-17-2015 08:30 am

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to take prescriptions as prescribed.   Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.

Defendant Gabriel S Becker in court.  Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for December 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Initial appearance at 11-23-2015 08:15 am

Defendant Gabriel S Becker not in court.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant's mother contacted the court stating defendant is not able to appear.  Court vacates previous order and warrant not to be issued.  Court stayes the issuance of the warrant until the next hearing.  Initial appearance scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Defendant Gabriel S Becker not in court.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
